"Sprint" widget
The "Sprint" widget
visually represents instances of the specified object type with a given ranking. The separation of type instances when displayed is implemented by filtering them.
Example of a customized widget:
The given example shows the progress of the "Purchase application" object in the business process.
Before you start configuring the widget, you need to create a new
entity
and proceed to creating instances for this object type.
The "Sprint" widget can be configured in the editing mode of the
visual of an instance
of an object type. To do this, you need to find the desired widget in the corresponding list in the "Elements" window and drag and drop it to the workspace.

Creating an object model and business process
First you need to create an object type (in the example "Purchase application"), which should contain attributes:
Application name [APPLICATION_NAME];
Application description [APPLICATION_DESCRIPTION];
Application status [APPLICATION_STATUS].
The last attribute is an object attribute and performs the function of a directory that takes into account the following application statuses:
Processing;
Coordination;
Approved.
Now you should create the following
business process
.
Then it is necessary to create instances in the registry of purchase orders. It is assumed that the executor, while completing the task of the business process, will update the status of the application according to the route.
Basic settings
To configure the widget, click the
button. The System will display the widget parameters.
A previously created entity, including its attributes, and attributes for the start date and end date of the parent object were specified in the widget parameters.
Widget parameters
Configuring the widget involves filling in the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Object type
Determining the object type whose instances will be displayed in the widget
Attribute for title
Determining the instance title of the previously specified object type. The attribute identifier is required
Attribute for description
Determining the description of an instance of the previously specified object type. The attribute identifier is required
Attributes for start date and end date
Selecting attributes to determine the start and end dates for displaying instances of the previously specified object type. The attribute identifier is required
Height (in % of the screen)
Determining the area to display the widget in % of the
workspace
. The numeric value must be specified
Display the filter
Determining filter display for instances of the previously specified object type in the widget
Filter setup
Filter of instances of the object type is set using the
button and configured for each column.

After saving the settings, the sprint columns will display instances of the specified object type for which a business process was started. There are tasks in the registry of the "WF.Task in the process" type. In this case, instances will be displayed in columns according to the filter setting.
Result
The "Sprint" widget setting defines only the object type, which instances will be displayed. Columns represent stages of the process and are set manually, so they do not depend on any attributes.
